title: BBC Local Live: Sheffield and South Yorkshire on Monday 4 January 2016 - BBC News
summary: second man arrested by police investigating new year 's eve killing in sheffield .
union calls for no confidence vote in south yorkshire fire service management .
askern triple fatal families say boxing day tragedy 'changed lives forever ' .
bus service shake-up in sheffield 'to improve punctuality ' .
council in funding warning over rotherham 's civic theatre .
new sixth form college opens to students in barnsley .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: live updates for sheffield and south yorkshire have finished for the day , but we 'll be back from 08:00 on tuesday 5 january with the latest news , sport , weather and travel updates from across the county .
author: Katie Galbraith
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: weather : outbreaks of showery rain overnight
text: staying cloudy overnight with outbreaks of showery rain .
the odd heavier burst here and there .
author: Paul Hudson
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: attack victim was ex-wednesday striker leon clarke 's father
text: a man who died after suffering head injuries in an attack on new year 's eve has been named as the father of former sheffield wednesday striker leon clarke ( left ) .
darrell clarke , 50 , died in hospital on saturday after being injured in an incident at the boat pub in wednesfield , west midlands .
he then went to the nearby royal tiger pub where an ambulance was called .
a murder inquiry is under way .
leon clarke , 30 , has also played for bury , wolves and coventry .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: 'trust has been lost ' at south yorkshire fire service , union says
text: the fire brigades union is calling for a vote of no confidence in senior fire officers at south yorkshire fire and rescue service .
it follows a meeting today where senior officers explained why they were paid thousands of pounds to cover firefighters during strike action .
the money has been paid back but neil carbutt , brigade secretary for the union says his members still are n't happy .
overwhelmingly our members have called for a vote of no confidence because , to be quite frank , they 've lost the trust and the confidence in their own workforce . ''
author: Phil Bodmer
Journalist, BBC Look North

documents.title: breakingsecond man arrested over new year 's eve killing
text: police have arrested a second man as part of a murder investigation following the death of zabair hussain in darnall on new year 's eve .
the 20-year-old local man was arrested this morning on sus of causing death by dangerous driving and remains in police custody , south yorkshire police said .
author: Katie Galbraith
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: family of sheffield murder victim left devastated
text: the heartbroken wife of a man murdered in sheffield on new year 's eve says their young son has been left devastated by his father 's tragic death .
author: Sheffield Star

documents.title: latest headlines : fire brigades union calls for vote of no confidence in senior fire officers and birds under threat do well in the peak district
text: the top stories in south yorkshire this afternoon include :

documents.title: no confidence vote call follows strike payments of almost £ 100,000
text: more on the news that the fire brigades union is calling for a vote of no confidence in senior fire officers at south yorkshire fire and rescue service .
it follows an official investigation which found that senior managers did n't follow proper procedures when they paid themselves nearly £ 100,000 in overtime payments during strikes two year ago .
although the payments were declared lawful the senior managers agreed to pay back the contingency payments .
the south yorkshire fire authority have been meeting today to discuss the issue .
author: Phil Bodmer
Journalist, BBC Look North

documents.title: breakingcall for vote of no confidence in fire service management
text: the fire brigades union is calling for a vote of no confidence in senior fire officers at south yorkshire fire and rescue service after they received overtime payments for covering during a strike .
more to follow .
author: Phil Bodmer
Journalist, BBC Look North

documents.title: deadline for council tenants in rotherham
text: up to £ 20,000 is being offered to rotherham council tenants who want to buy their own home under a new government-backed scheme .
the offer is only open for a short time and funds are limited .
rotherham council
rmbcpress
deadline date of 8 jan for # rotherham council tenants wishing to apply for up to £ 20k to help buy a home bit.ly/1ouc4yz
if you are interested and meet the criteria to apply please email the council 's strategic housing team by friday 8 january .
deadline date of 8 jan for # rotherham council tenants wishing to apply for up to £ 20k to help buy a home

documents.title: population of threatened whinchats doubles in peak district 's eastern moors
text: since the national trust and the rspb took over the management of the peak district 's eastern moors on the edge of sheffield five years ago the number of whinchats has more than doubled .
a recent survey shows the population of the threatened bird increased from 25 pairs in 2010 to 60 pairs in 2015 .

this small orange-crested bird , which arrives every summer from africa to breed in the british uplands , was recently added to the red list of high conservation concern following a 50 % decline in the uk since the 1990s .
nature conservationists at the eastern moors partnership believe the success of these birds locally is due to a gradual reduction in sheep grazing and a shift towards the use of cattle on the land .
when cattle graze they create a varied habitat , which provides a range of potential nest sites and food sources such as insects .
author: Katie Galbraith
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: blades striker extends loan spell at portsmouth
text: portsmouth have extended the loan of striker marc mcnulty from sheffield united until the end of the season .
the 23-year-old scot has scored six goals in 11 games , including a hat-trick against york , since initially arriving on loan in november .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: latest from fire service strike payment meeting
text: senior officers have been meeting with south yorkshire fire authority to explain how they were paid thousands of pounds to cover for firefighters during strike action two years ago .
some officers at south yorkshire fire service were paid over £ 14,000 .
the fire brigades union claims their contracts already included overtime .
the money was voluntarily paid back amid calls for the resignation of the chair of the fire authority .
however , in a statement councillor jim andrews apologised and explained lessons had been learned .
he said he would ensure recommendations to avoid it happening again were now implemented .
author: Phil Bodmer
Journalist, BBC Look North

documents.title: rising waters lead to road being closed for a second time
text: looks like forstead lane between arksey and barnby dun has been closed for a second time today .
doncaster council
mydoncaster
update : forstead lane has been closed due to rising water , gates also closed arrangements being made to implement full diversionary route
update : forstead lane has been closed due to rising water , gates also closed arrangements being made to implement full diversionary route

documents.title: government 's housebuilding plans not enough says shadow minister
text: the mp for wentworth and dearne , john healey , has criticised government plans to kick-start housebuilding .
this follows the announcement that smaller developers are to be given the chance to buy public sector land with planning permission in place to fast-track housebuilding .
communities secretary greg clark told the bbc the government was `` pulling out all the stops to get the country building '' .
but mr healey , the shadow housing minister , says there 's no promise for more investment .
`` today 's statement promises no new starter homes beyond those already announced , '' he said .

`` with home ownership down to the lowest level in a generation and fewer homes built over the last five years than under any peacetime government since the 1920s , david cameron needs to do much more to fix his five years of failure on housing . ''

documents.title: sheffield 's john walton progresses at darts bdo world championships
text: sheffield 's former champion john walton made a triumphant return to lakeside this afternoon , beating australia 's rob modra 3-0 to reach round one of the bdo world championships .
the 54-year-old dropped only three legs in his preliminary-round win , which set up a first-round tie with 15th seed and fellow yorkshireman brian dawson .
walton , the 2001 champion , last appeared at lakeside in 2013 and had not won a match there for five years .
author: Phil Cartwright
BBC Sport

documents.title: sweet success : unravelling the dark past of jelly babies
text: the humble jelly baby has been giving fans a sugary thrill for generations , but the apparently innocuous treat harbours a somewhat dark and mysterious past .
news has taken a look at its journey from a lancashire sweet factory to mass-produced giant of the confectionery world manufactured by bassett 's of sheffield .

documents.title: weather : rain showers into this afternoon becoming more frequent and persistent later on
text: good weather for plants this afternoon !
rain showers throughout the afternoon becoming more frequent and persistent .
top temperatures of around 7c ( 45f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: latest headlines : crash families thank community for support and blades striker extends loan spell at portsmouth
text: the top stories in south yorkshire this lunchtime include :
author: Jenny Cork
BBC Sheffield, Local Live

documents.title: families thank the community after fatal crash in askern
text: more from the families ' statement released following the deaths of andrew tomlinson , 48 , fay tomlinson , 54 , and mandy deere , 54 , in the askern area of doncaster on boxing day .
it says : `` we would like to sincerely thank the community of askern , and doncaster , for their continued generosity with fundraising towards funeral costs for andrew , fay and mandy .
`` we are extremely humbled by the number of people who have donated , laid flowers and attended the recent memorial to support our family and offer their condolences . ''
john deere , 57 , who was injured in the incident , remains in a critical condition in hospital .

documents.title: askern boxing day fatal crash 'changed lives forever ' say victims ' families
text: the families of andrew tomlinson , 48 , faye tomlinson , 54 , and mandy deere , 54 , who died after being hit by a car in the askern area of doncaster on boxing day , have released a statement .

it says : `` boxing day 's tragic events have devastated our family , changing lives forever , leaving behind nine children , 19 grandchildren , parents , brothers , sisters , nieces and nephews , who are completely heartbroken .
`` there is now a huge hole in our family which will never be repaired . ''

ricky hepworth , 24 , from meadow cross in edenthorpe , is due to appear at sheffield crown court later this month faced with 14 charges , including causing death by dangerous driving , aggravated vehicle taking and driving while uninsured and unlicensed .

documents.title: watch : pothole repairs allow swinton road to reopen
text: do you remember that pothole that was causing problems in swinton earlier today ?
they had to close the the b6090 wentworth road between the a633 and the b6089 road .
well it looks like it 's been filled in and the road has now been re-opened
author: Andy Kershaw
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: watch : tour of the new sixth form college in barnsley
text: i 've been on a tour of the new sixth form college which has opened in barnsley town centre today .
eighteen million pounds has been spent on the project and the principal liz leek is very proud of the new building .
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Radio Sheffield reporter

documents.title: watch : barnsley 's john foster on life as a victorian baker
text: barnsley baker john foster has been talking about his appearance on the bbc two television show victorian bakers .
in the first episode he goes back to a rural bake house in 1837 .
the first loaves are made with heritage wheat flour and brewers ' yeast in a tiny wood-fired oven .
in the second show they move into an urban bakery in the midst of the industrial revolution .
the bakers are still kneading by hand whilst being expected to double their output .
in the final show it 's 1900 and the bakers have moved into an elegant shop on the high street .
watch john talk about the show
author: Katie Galbraith
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: more changes to bus services in sheffield
text: further changes to bus services have been introduced in sheffield .
the bus companies say they are making changes to 13 routes to improve punctuality and reliability after the big changes in november .
the shake-up last year involved removing , replacing , reducing and renumbering buses across the city .
the south yorkshire passenger transport executive said it would improve the bus network but there was widespread criticism from bus passengers .
a petition to reverse the changes was signed by more than 12,000 people .
author: Katie Galbraith
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: doors open at new sixth form college barnsley
text: a new sixth form college opens today in barnsley town centre .
it 's on the site of the former central library on st mary 's place next to the town hall .
it 'll start with 650 students , rising to 1,200 .
this is what it looks like inside one of the classrooms .
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Radio Sheffield reporter

documents.title: fire service strike payments meeting in barnsley
text: senior fire officers will meet today to explain how they were paid thousands of pounds to cover firefighters during strike action .

an official investigation found that senior managers at south yorkshire fire service did n't follow proper procedures when they paid themselves nearly £ 100,000 in overtime payments during strikes two years ago .
although the payments were declared lawful the senior managers agreed to pay back the contingency payments .
the south yorkshire fire authority is due to meet at 10am in barnsley .
author: Katie Galbraith
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: barnsley baker travels back in time for new bbc tv series
text: the boss of a bakery in barnsley features in a new bbc television series this week .
john foster from foster 's bakers in mapplewell is one of the stars of victorian bakers .
you can see the first episode at 20:00 on bbc two tomorrow .
during the series he 'll use authentic methods and recipes from three distinct eras of the 19th century .
john is the one in the glasses
author: Katie Galbraith
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live coverage
text: hello and welcome to bbc local live in sheffield and south yorkshire on monday 4 january 2016 .
we 'll be with you until 18:00 with the latest news , views , weather , sport and travel updates from across the county .
please feel free to send me your news , and comments .
author: Katie Galbraith
BBC Radio Sheffield
